author: Elastic
attributes.description: This rule detects the use of the mount utility from inside a privileged container. The mount command is used to make a device or file system accessible to the system, and then to connect its root directory to a specified mount point on the local file system. When launched inside a privileged container--a container deployed with all the capabilities of the host machine-- an attacker can access sensitive host level files which could be used for further privilege escalation and container escapes to the host machine. Any usage of mount inside a running privileged container should be further investigated.
attributes.name: Mount Launched Inside a Privileged Container
attributes.query:
process where event.module == "cloud_defend" and  event.type== "start" and 
(process.name== "mount" or process.args== "mount") and container.security_context.privileged == true
tags: Data Source: Elastic Defend for Containers
